bill_title: temporarily increase the state sales and use tax and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to temporarily increase the state sales and use tax and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 10-45 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: In addition to the tax imposed by §§ 10-45-2, 10-45-5, 10-45-5.3, 10-45-6, 10-45-6.1, 10-45-6.2, 10-45-8, and 10-45-71 there is hereby imposed an additional tax of one percent upon the gross receipts from sales of tangible personal property, services, and products transferred electronically during the months of June, July, and August. Section 2. That chapter 10-46 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: In addition to the tax imposed by §§ 10-46-2.1, 10-46-2.2, 10-46-58, 10-46-69, 10-46-69.1, and 10-46-69.2 there is hereby imposed an additional tax of one percent upon the privilege of the use, storage, or consumption of tangible personal property, services, and products transferred electronically during the months of June, July, and August. Section 3. The provisions of this Act are repealed on September 1, 2015. Section 4. If the proposed initiated measure that increases the sales and use tax imposed by chapters 10-45 and 10-46 is passed by the voters of this state on November 6, 2012, the provisions of this Act are repealed on January 1, 2013. Section 5. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect on June 1, 2012, after its passage and approval.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
